Timestamp for final delivery confirmation (nullable).

IAimallBackendShipment.description: Represents an atomic delivery/fulfillment event for an order. All fields are strictly normalized, and one record exists for each physical shipment event.

order_id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the order to which this shipment is related. It must reference an existing order record. This field enables shipment-to-order assignment and ensures proper normalization. Required for all shipment operations. Example: 'a3818756-3e5f-4b8e-bf47-eed18605d1c1'.

shipment_address_id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) for the delivery address associated with this shipment. Points to a valid address in the system and is mandatory for all outgoing shipments. Used for label printing and logistics API integration.

carrier.description: Name of the shipping carrier handling this shipment event. E.g., 'CJ Logistics', 'FedEx', 'UPS'. The value should be the carrier's business or fulfillment name as assigned by logistics arrangements. Used in customer notifications and compliance records.

oneOf.description: Optional. Alphanumeric tracking code supplied by the carrier when available. If unknown at shipment creation, supply null and update later. Provides shipment traceability in fulfillment flows. Example: '1Z9999Y70200370006'.

Optional. Alphanumeric tracking code supplied by the carrier when available. If unknown at shipment creation, supply null and update later. Provides shipment traceability in fulfillment flows. Example: '1Z9999Y70200370006'.

tracking_number.description: Optional. Alphanumeric tracking code supplied by the carrier when available. If unknown at shipment creation, supply null and update later. Provides shipment traceability in fulfillment flows. Example: '1Z9999Y70200370006'.

shipment_status.description: Current status/state code for shipment fulfillment. Examples include 'pending', 'shipped', 'delivered'. Must match business-state model as per logistics provider/manual operation. Required.

oneOf.description: Timestamp the shipment was dispatched. ISO 8601 UTC datetime string, or null if not dispatched yet. Used in fulfillment metrics and SLA calculations.
Timestamp the shipment was dispatched. ISO 8601 UTC datetime string, or null if not dispatched yet. Used in fulfillment metrics and SLA calculations.

shipped_at.description: Timestamp the shipment was dispatched. ISO 8601 UTC datetime string, or null if not dispatched yet. Used in fulfillment metrics and SLA calculations.

oneOf.description: Timestamp the delivery was completed. ISO 8601 UTC datetime string, nullable for 'in transit' or not-yet-delivered. Used in analytics and delivery compliance.
Timestamp the delivery was completed. ISO 8601 UTC datetime string, nullable for 'in transit' or not-yet-delivered. Used in analytics and delivery compliance.

delivered_at.description: Timestamp the delivery was completed. ISO 8601 UTC datetime string, nullable for 'in transit' or not-yet-delivered. Used in analytics and delivery compliance.

IAimallBackendShipment.ICreate.description: DTO for creating a new shipment event in the order fulfillment flow. Used by sellers or admin users to schedule, dispatch, and record a shipment linked to an order. All fields are atomic and directly reflect the shipment audit schema. Business rules may require validation for carrier, status values, and address existence.

oneOf.description: Optional updated shipping carrier name. This is a string value and updates the delivery/fulfillment provider for the shipment.
Optional updated shipping carrier name. This is a string value and updates the delivery/fulfillment provider for the shipment.

carrier.description: Optional updated shipping carrier name. This is a string value and updates the delivery/fulfillment provider for the shipment.

oneOf.description: Optional. New or corrected carrier tracking number. Can be null if tracking is still unavailable. Used to maintain shipment traceability.
Optional. New or corrected carrier tracking number. Can be null if tracking is still unavailable. Used to maintain shipment traceability.

tracking_number.description: Optional. New or corrected carrier tracking number. Can be null if tracking is still unavailable. Used to maintain shipment traceability.

oneOf.description: Optional. Updated status of this shipment. Must match acceptable status values for the business process, e.g., 'pending', 'shipped', 'delivered'. Null means status unchanged. Changing status can trigger event notifications.

Optional. Updated status of this shipment. Must match acceptable status values for the business process, e.g., 'pending', 'shipped', 'delivered'. Null means status unchanged. Changing status can trigger event notifications.

shipment_status.description: Optional. Updated status of this shipment. Must match acceptable status values for the business process, e.g., 'pending', 'shipped', 'delivered'. Null means status unchanged. Changing status can trigger event notifications.

oneOf.description: Optional. The new or corrected timestamp for when the shipment was shipped. Null means not set or unmodified.
Optional. The new or corrected timestamp for when the shipment was shipped. Null means not set or unmodified.

shipped_at.description: Optional. The new or corrected timestamp for when the shipment was shipped. Null means not set or unmodified.

oneOf.description: Optional. Record or update the completion timestamp for delivery confirmation. Null if the delivery is incomplete or to be reset.
Optional. Record or update the completion timestamp for delivery confirmation. Null if the delivery is incomplete or to be reset.

delivered_at.description: Optional. Record or update the completion timestamp for delivery confirmation. Null if the delivery is incomplete or to be reset.

IAimallBackendShipment.IUpdate.description: DTO for updating an existing shipment record. All properties are optional and represent atomic fields within the shipment record. Setting a value will replace the previous database value, while omitted properties remain unchanged.

order_id.description: UUID of the order to which this snapshot relates. Used for filtering snapshots of a particular order.

snapshot_type.description: Type/category of the snapshot event (e.g., 'created', 'cancelled', 'fulfilled', 'modified'). Used to filter snapshots by business event.

snapshot_at_from.description: Lower bound (inclusive) for the snapshot timestamp filter. Used to query for snapshots since a particular point in time.

snapshot_at_to.description: Upper bound (inclusive) for the snapshot timestamp filter. Used to query for snapshots up to a certain date/time.

limit.description: Maximum number of records to return in this page. Used for pagination. Default is typically 100.

page.description: Page number to return for paginated results. 1-based index.

IAimallBackendOrderSnapshot.IRequest.description: Request DTO for searching/filtering order snapshot records to support audit/compliance flows. Used for admin, customer, or seller purpose.

order_id.description: UUID of the order that is being snapshotted (audited). Must reference a valid, existing order.

snapshot_type.description: Type of history event: e.g. 'created', 'modified', 'cancelled', 'fulfilled', etc. Used for audit and compliance traceability.

snapshot_data.description: A full, serialized JSON string snapshot of the order at this time. Typically captured at the point the event is triggered. Should be a stringified representation of the order and associated entities. Structured validation is handled application-side.

snapshot_at.description: Timestamp indicating when this snapshot was created. An ISO 8601 UTC date string (e.g., '2025-07-29T15:57:29.936Z').

IAimallBackendOrderSnapshot.ICreate.description: DTO for creating a new audit/compliance snapshot of an order entity. All fields required.

snapshot_type.description: If updating event type for this historical snapshot. Example: 'cancelled', 'fulfilled', 'error_correction'.

snapshot_data.description: New full serialized snapshot (JSON string) of the order state, to replace previous value. Used for audit correction, not standard operation.

snapshot_at.description: Timestamp for the snapshot; replacement only in compliance or correction flows.

IAimallBackendOrderSnapshot.IUpdate.description: DTO for updating certain non-immutable fields in an order snapshot. Typically used for correction or compliance adjustments. All fields are optional; only those provided are updated.

id.description: Primary key (UUID) of the snapshot.

order_id.description: Referenced order (UUID) being snapshotted.

snapshot_data.description: Serialized JSON describing full order state at this point in time, including order, items, payments, and shipments. Used for compliance, rollback, and audit.

snapshot_at.description: Timestamp record (ISO 8601 UTC with timezone, e.g. '2025-07-29T15:57:29.936Z').

IAimallBackendOrderSnapshot.description: Schema type for a historical snapshot of order business state, used for audit, rollback, and compliance. This object captures the entire state at a notable business event moment.

IPageIAimallBackendOrderSnapshot.description: Paginated result wrapper for lists of order snapshot entries.

IPageIAimallBackendCoupon.description: Paginated result wrapper for a list of coupon entities.

discount_campaign_id.description: Restriction to coupons under a specific campaign (UUID).

customer_id.description: Optional. Restricts to coupons assigned to a particular customer.

code.description: Coupon code filter (supports partial or exact search for code matching).

status.description: Filter for issued/redeemed/expired/invalidated. Only single status allowed.

issued_at_from.description: Filter lower bound for issuance date.

issued_at_to.description: Filter upper bound for issuance date.

expires_at_from.description: Lower bound for coupon expiry window.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

IAimallBackendCoupon.IRequest.description: Advanced search/filter parameters for retrieving/coupon query, as per aimall_backend_coupons fields. Used by administrator or customer-facing UIs.

discount_campaign_id.description: UUID of the associated discount campaign to which the coupon belongs. Foreign key must reference an existing campaign entry.

oneOf.description: Optional. UUID of the customer who is being assigned this coupon (for personal coupon issuance), or null for universal coupons.
Optional. UUID of the customer who is being assigned this coupon (for personal coupon issuance), or null for universal coupons.

customer_id.description: Optional. UUID of the customer who is being assigned this coupon (for personal coupon issuance), or null for universal coupons.

code.description: The unique code string associated with this coupon (e.g., 'NEWYEAR25', 'VIPONLY2025'). Constraints apply for uniqueness and format, enforced application-side.

status.description: Initial status for new coupon, typically 'issued'. Enum values allowed: 'issued', 'redeemed', 'expired', 'invalidated'.

issued_at.description: Timestamp when the coupon is issued. Must be current/future ISO 8601 UTC datetime.

expires_at.description: When the coupon will expire. Must be in the future relative to issued_at. ISO 8601 UTC datetime.

IAimallBackendCoupon.ICreate.description: Input object for creating a new coupon voucher under a campaign.

oneOf.description: Optional. Assign (update) a customer recipient for the coupon, or null for universal coupons.
Optional. Assign (update) a customer recipient for the coupon, or null for universal coupons.

customer_id.description: Optional. Assign (update) a customer recipient for the coupon, or null for universal coupons.

code.description: Update coupon code. Should remain unique to the campaign; may not be mutable for redeemed/expired coupons per business rule.

status.description: Set new coupon status, e.g., 'redeemed', 'expired', 'invalidated'. Only permitted updates according to business logic.

issued_at.description: Update for the issuance timestamp (e.g., as part of administrative correction).

expires_at.description: Update the coupon expiration field. Only allowed if still in 'issued' state.

redeemed_at.description: Set this field to record redemption time (for admin triggering redemptions, compliance, or data repair flows). Optional.

IAimallBackendCoupon.IUpdate.description: DTO for updating coupon voucher records. All fields are optional and business rules govern when fields may be changed.

id.description: Primary key (UUID) coupon voucher row.

discount_campaign_id.description: Campaign (UUID) this coupon is associated with. FK to campaigns table.

oneOf.description: Assigned customer for this coupon (if present), or null for universal coupons.
Assigned customer for this coupon (if present), or null for universal coupons.

customer_id.description: Assigned customer for this coupon (if present), or null for universal coupons.

code.description: Unique code for the coupon voucher.

status.description: Current lifecycle status of the coupon; e.g., 'issued', 'redeemed', 'expired', 'invalidated'.

expires_at.description: Coupon expiration timestamp, after which no further redemption allowed.

oneOf.description: Timestamp when coupon was redeemed; null if not used.
Timestamp when coupon was redeemed; null if not used.

redeemed_at.description: Timestamp when coupon was redeemed; null if not used.

IAimallBackendCoupon.description: Schema type for actual coupon voucher as stored; tracks status, code, assignment, and lifecycle. Used in rewards, discounts, and promotion analytics.

IPageIAimallBackendDiscountCampaign.description:
A paginated collection of discount campaign records as defined in the AIMall backend. This type is used for displaying and batching discount campaign entities, complying with pagination standards. It includes a pagination metadata object and the array of campaign items.

All properties are strictly normalized and align with audit and tracking requirements described in the discount and loyalty system documentation.

id.description: Primary key UUID for the discount campaign. Referenced throughout coupon and analytics records for campaign scoping and audit trail.

name.description: Display name for the discount campaign visible to admin and reporting tools. Must be unique within UI and analytics context. This is a normalized, atomic field only. See campaign documentation in the discount and loyalty system requirements.

code.description: System-unique code for the campaign (e.g., 'BLACKFRIDAY2025'). Used for programmatic lookups, input validation, and campaign stacking logic. Uniqueness enforced by schema and required for advanced cross-referencing in coupon and fraud detection.

type.description: Type of discount logic (e.g., 'order', 'product'). Defines whether rules apply at the order or product line level for eligibility and campaign tracking. Must conform to business rules described in campaign entity docs.

status.description: Current status of the campaign ('active', 'inactive', 'ended', etc.). Used for operational control and campaign lifecycle transitions. See campaign state machine as defined in functional requirements.

stackable.description: True if this campaign can be combined (stacked) with others, subject to platform stacking rules. This is a core business logic field as described in campaign stacking requirements.

start_at.description: Timestamp at which the campaign becomes eligible for discounts or coupon issuance/application. Must be in ISO 8601 format. Business logic must enforce campaign eligibility windows.

end_at.description: Timestamp after which the campaign is no longer valid for discount/coupon application. ISO 8601 format; used for reporting and fraud analytics.

oneOf.description: Maximum number of times an individual user can redeem benefits under this campaign. A null or 0 means unlimited per requirements. Must comply with campaign-level and coupon issuance rules.
Maximum number of times an individual user can redeem benefits under this campaign. A null or 0 means unlimited per requirements. Must comply with campaign-level and coupon issuance rules.

max_uses_per_user.description: Maximum number of times an individual user can redeem benefits under this campaign. A null or 0 means unlimited per requirements. Must comply with campaign-level and coupon issuance rules.

priority.description: Campaign priority for stacking/precedence resolution. Higher INTEGERS override lower ones. Used in conflict detection and order of application analytics.

oneOf.description: Long-form business/admin description of what this campaign is used for. Intended for compliance, audit tracing, and staff review. Nullable.
Long-form business/admin description of what this campaign is used for. Intended for compliance, audit tracing, and staff review. Nullable.

description.description: Long-form business/admin description of what this campaign is used for. Intended for compliance, audit tracing, and staff review. Nullable.

IAimallBackendDiscountCampaign.description:
A discount campaign entity for platform-wide or scoped discount rules, as modeled in the AIMall Prisma schema. Captures major campaign attributes, eligibility rules, stacking, assignment, audit, and business tracking.

Strictly normalized and used wherever a discount campaign is referenced in coupons, redemptions, and analytic workflows. All property documentation references schema comments and operational system requirements.

page.description: Requested page number (for pagination). Optional; if null, defaults to first page as per pagination schema.

Records per page. Optional; null or omitted uses system default (typically 100 for admin UIs).

limit.description: Records per page. Optional; null or omitted uses system default (typically 100 for admin UIs).

oneOf.description: Lower bound for campaign active window. If provided, only returns campaigns with start_at >= this value.
Lower bound for campaign active window. If provided, only returns campaigns with start_at >= this value.

start_at_from.description: Lower bound for campaign active window. If provided, only returns campaigns with start_at >= this value.

oneOf.description: Upper bound for campaign active window. If supplied, only returns campaigns with start_at <= this value.

start_at_to.description: Upper bound for campaign active window. If supplied, only returns campaigns with start_at <= this value.

Lower bound for campaign end window.

IAimallBackendDiscountCampaign.IRequest.description:
Request DTO for advanced search, filtering, and pagination of discount campaigns.

All fields optional; supports partial matches and administrative dashboard bulk-management per campaign search/filtering scenario.

name.description: Required display/business name for the campaign. Must be human-readable, normalized, and unique system-wide within the admin UIs for clarity.

code.description: Required programmatic (unique) code for the campaign. This is used for logic, API, and stacking management—see campaign code best practices in governance docs.

type.description: Campaign type (e.g., 'order', 'product'). Required for campaign creation, scoping, and definition. Validation applies as documented in campaign functional requirements.

status.description: Initial status for the new campaign (must match allowed business values—typically 'active', 'inactive', etc.).

stackable.description: True if campaign is combinable/stackable with others. Must match stacking governance described in system requirements.

start_at.description: ISO 8601 start timestamp for when campaign launches. Must not overlap ineligible business periods as per compliance docs.

end_at.description: ISO 8601 end timestamp for when campaign ends.

oneOf.description: Limits user redemptions in the campaign (0 or null for unlimited).
Limits user redemptions in the campaign (0 or null for unlimited).

max_uses_per_user.description: Limits user redemptions in the campaign (0 or null for unlimited).

priority.description: Campaign priority for conflict/stack logic. Integer—see campaign precedence model.

oneOf.description: Admin/business notes for the campaign. Supports system documentation and audit. Nullable field.
Admin/business notes for the campaign. Supports system documentation and audit. Nullable field.

description.description: Admin/business notes for the campaign. Supports system documentation and audit. Nullable field.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty transaction record, assigned as a UUID at creation. Used for database lookups, auditing, and reference from other records or systems.

customer_id.description: Reference to the customer who owns or receives this loyalty transaction (foreign key to customer table). Critical for compliance, audit, fraud detection, and analytics. Must always be present and valid.

Reference to the order event related to this loyalty transaction, or null if not order-triggered (e.g., sign-up bonus, manual adjustment). Patterns in business logic typically connect accrual/redemption to an order completion event. Nullable field.

order_id.description: Reference to the order event related to this loyalty transaction, or null if not order-triggered (e.g., sign-up bonus, manual adjustment). Patterns in business logic typically connect accrual/redemption to an order completion event. Nullable field.

Reference to the coupon responsible for this transaction (if applicable, e.g., coupon benefit), or null if not triggered by coupon. Helps analyze coupon vs. general activity patterns.

type.description: Type of loyalty transaction event: 'accrual', 'redemption', 'expiration', or 'refund_reversal', as defined in the business logic. String type for forward compatibility.

expired_at.description: If this transaction resulted in point or mileage expiration, this field is the effective timestamp for that expiration. Null if not an expiration event.

subject.description:
The subject line of the support ticket, summarizing the issue or request.

Editable by ticket owners, administrative staff, or support agents. Refer to the aimall_backend_support_tickets schema for strict normalization and typical business workflows. Changing the subject triggers an audit event and may impact queue triage or rerouting.

body.description:
The detailed body of the support ticket, providing all necessary context, description, or reproduction steps for the support issue or business inquiry.

A high level of detail assists agents and reduces resolution time. Only the ticket owner or authorized staff may modify this field. Audited on update.

status.description:
Status flag for the support ticket, specifying workflow position: e.g., 'open', 'pending', 'resolved', 'closed'.

Allowed values: application-enforced, e.g., ["open", "pending", "resolved", "closed"]. Status transitions are logged for compliance and business SLAs.

priority.description:
Priority of the support issue (e.g., 'low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent').

Essential for agent queue triage; limited to enumerated values by system configuration. Only updatable by ticket owners (any role) or administrators.

category.description:
Category code for the support ticket: e.g., 'account', 'order', 'payment', 'technical', etc.

Used for ticket routing, escalation, reporting and analytics. Application logic will provide a list of valid values, refer to documentation or admin panel. Modifiable by ticket owner and support staff.

IAimallBackendAuditLog.IRequest.description:
요청 바디 타입은 감사 로그 목록, 필터링, 또는 감사 로그 상세 검색과 같은 복잡한 분석/필터링을 지원합니다. 이 타입은 analytics(분석) 시스템 내에서 로그 이벤트를 검색 및 정렬할 때 사용되며, 모든 필드는 atomic이며 Prisma 스키마의 실 데이터에만 해당됩니다. 관리자 대시보드, 컴플라이언스(Audit) 흐름, 대규모 시스템 내 감사/사고 대응/운영상 필수적입니다.

- event_type(이벤트 종류), actor_id(사건 담당자), event_target(대상 시스템/리소스), outcome(성공/실패 등), ip_address 등 다양한 필터가 지원됩니다.
- 페이지네이션 및 정렬 지원: 페이징 필드(page, limit), 정렬(sort), 검색어(keyword), 날짜 범위(start_date, end_date) 등 필요 필드는 모두 정의되어야 합니다.
- 보안/컴플라이언스: 접근 권한에 따라 일부 속성은 마스킹/미출력될 수 있음.

이 타입은 IAimallBackendAuditLog 쿼리를 위한 요청 DTO로, 정규화된 필드만을 통해 고급 감사 로그 쿼리 및 배포 시스템에서 사용됩니다.

limit.description: 한 페이지당 조회할 로그 개수. 예시: 20, 50, 100 등. 시스템 정책 따라 제한될 수 있음.

oneOf.description: 조회하고자 하는 이벤트(동작) 타입 또는 그 패턴. 예: 'LOGIN', 'PERMISSION_CHANGE', 'DASHBOARD_UPDATE', ...

IAimallBackendAuditLog.description:
analytics(분석) 시스템의 감사 로그(Audit Log) 단일 엔터티 레코드. 이 타입은 플랫폼 내 모든 주요 관리자/시스템/자동화 이벤트, 데이터 변화, 설정 변경, 접근 기록 등을 위한 정규화된 감사 이력을 제공합니다. 모든 데이터는 Prisma schema의 aimall_backend_audit_logs 를 완전히 반영하며, 데이터는 변경 불가(append-only, no update) 정책에 사용됩니다.

- event_type: 이벤트 종류 ('LOGIN', 'PERMISSION_CHANGE', 'DASHBOARD_UPDATE' 등).
- actor_id: 이벤트를 수행한 담당 관리자(actors domain).
- event_target: 대상 엔티티 식별자(대시보드/설정키/외부자원 등).
- ip_address: 접속 IP (nullable).
- outcome: 'SUCCESS', 'FAILED', 'DENIED' 등 결과.
- detail_json: 상세 context(Json직렬) (nullable).
- created_at: 타임스탬프(UTC 및 ISO 8601, 생성시점 결과값 DB 입력됨).

보안/컴플라이언스적 신뢰성과 이력감사, 표준 감사/로그분석 기능 구현의 핵심 타입입니다. 모든 하위/상위 시스템의 Audit/AOP, Dashboard, Admin 등에서 공통 사용합니다.

id.description: 감사 로그의 UUID 기본키. 레코드 1:1 고유 식별자.

oneOf.description: 이벤트를 실행/주도한 관리자(actors/administrators)의 아이디. 시스템 프로세스/익명/백엔드인 경우 null 허용.

actor_id.description: 이벤트를 실행/주도한 관리자(actors/administrators)의 아이디. 시스템 프로세스/익명/백엔드인 경우 null 허용.

event_type.description: 이벤트 종류(동작 구분) - 예: 'LOGIN', 'PERMISSION_CHANGE', 'DASHBOARD_UPDATE', etc. 주요 Audit 구분자. 쉼표 없이 대문자/언더스코어 조합.

oneOf.description: 감사 이벤트의 대상 리소스/식별자. 예: dashboard code, config key, resource id 등. 없을 경우 null.
감사 이벤트의 대상 리소스/식별자. 예: dashboard code, config key, resource id 등. 없을 경우 null.

이벤트 발생 당시 IP 주소. 서버/시스템훅/자동화에서는 null.

oneOf.description: 이벤트 상세 context/증빙/추가 메타데이터(직렬화된 json string, nullable, 없음=필드생략). 예: {"previous_role":"user","new_role":"admin"}, 첨부 등.
